title: Process Tools
description: Find, prioritize, and control processes during development workflows.

cards.prompt: Using Linux process tools, search for processes matching python and show PID plus command line.
cards.explanation: -a prints full command line, -f matches against full command.

cards.prompt: Using Linux process tools, list PIDs of nginx processes owned by user deploy.
cards.explanation: -u filters to processes owned by a user.

cards.prompt: Using Linux process tools, terminate processes matching full command node server.js.
Using Linux process tools, send SIGTERM to all sleep processes.
cards.explanation: -15 is SIGTERM; graceful stop when possible.

cards.prompt: Using Linux process tools, force-kill all sleep processes with SIGKILL.
Using Linux process tools, show a process tree for PID 1.
cards.explanation: -p includes process IDs in the tree output.

cards.prompt: Using Linux process tools, start python worker.py immune to hangups.
cards.explanation: nohup keeps the process alive after terminal disconnect.

cards.prompt: Using Linux process tools, start long_task.sh with nice value 10.
Using Linux process tools, change PID 4242 to nice value -5.
cards.explanation: renice updates priority of a running process.

cards.prompt: Using Linux process tools, run df -h every 2 seconds.
cards.explanation: watch repeats a command at a fixed interval.

cards.prompt: Using Linux process tools, measure execution time of pytest -q.
cards.explanation: time reports real/user/sys duration for a command.

cards.prompt: Using Linux process tools, run time in verbose mode for make test.
cards.explanation: /usr/bin/time -v includes memory and context switch stats.
